alert.note: Alert for Pulaski; Wythe (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 2:47AM EST until January 11 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Virginia... New River AT Allisonia affecting Pulaski and Wythe Counties. For the New River...including Allisonia...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...New River at Allisonia. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, River begins to overflow the left bank and affect Clarks Ferry Road, Route 653. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 8.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 7.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:30 AM EST Wednesday was 8.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 8.4 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage this afternoon. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.4 feet on 01/08/1946. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 300 PM EST.
